column4: Hi all, anyone has an idea as why my FF7 sometimes starts eating one core to a 100% for a while then drops back? I cannot link it to a specific action or event...
i like FF, and it's just been annoying me for a little while so i'll try to stay with it...
i have been doing a start private broswer in firefox when i am going to idle
the problem is not the memory, the cpu goes crazy on one core then goes quiet agzin...
see if there are any build args for hyper threading support for ff...  just a guess
I hope it doesnt start eating my quadcores together once i enable the threading...
soy for being a joy-breaker but... not yet, I'm still looking for it...
I'd be more worried about it stressing at 100% with a program that is notorious for memory hogging
luckily it's not, what "worries" me is that i've yet to hear about someone else having that problem...

from ver 9 - If you are running a pentium machine with hyper-threading, turn the hyper-threading off in the machine's bios. Having had the same problem you are reporting on two machines, this has fixed the firefox issues on both of them.
so we're at "hardware" has to adapt to "software", not good...
heh, opera sounding better yet? do a /proc/cpuinfo for me
is "Intel(R) Core(TM) i5 CPU       M 460  @ 2.53GHz" enough or do you need the whole thing?
